content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a risk-averse and security-valuing individual, I would choose the option that offers the most consistent outcome over the long term, even if it is slightly less than the maximum payoff. In this case, choosing 'B' consistently provides a guaranteed payout of 12$ per round (totaling 900$ for 75 rounds), while there is a risk of earning nothing in each round when choosing 'R' if the anonymous player chooses 'B'. Therefore, my choice would be to pick 'B' ({B}).
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

In this situation, I have chosen 'B', and my opponent has also chosen 'B'. We both receive a payout of 12$ each for this round. Now, as we continue to play the game, I will stick with my strategy of choosing 'B' because it provides a consistent and secure outcome, even if it is less than the maximum possible payoff. So, I will choose 'B' again ({B}) for the next round.
